title: Lists & Tables
info:
Lists and tables can be used in HTML to display content in an easy to read and informative format. HTML lists come in two types, unordered and ordered. Unordered lists default to circle bullet points. Unordered lists use
    and
tags (Stands for unordered list!) with
    • list elements inside.
    • Item
    • Another item

Ordered lists are similar to unordered lists, but have numbers instead of circle bullet points. Ordered lists use
    and
tags (Stands for ordered list!) with
    • list elements inside.
    1. Item One
    2. Item Two

Html tables are created using the
element.
Each table is split up into rows filled with content. Each row can be created with and tags.
Data can be populated in these rows using and components. The component creates a header, the component creates text.
